info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 8:15PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Clay and northeastern Dunklin Counties through 900 PM CDT... At 815 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Dexter to near Qulin to Success. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Malden, Piggott, Corning, Campbell, Chalk Bluff Natural Area, Clarkton, Holcomb, Reyno, Knobel, St. Francis, Pollard, Greenway, McDougal, Success, Peach Orchard, Datto, Glennonville, Saint Francis, Crockett and Tipperary. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
